private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels.
Vowel blocks present in the environment: A, E, I, O.
I can move only the top block of any stack and only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so they form the target chain A on B on C ... O on table by moving vowel-labeled top blocks when appropriate.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants.
Consonant blocks present in the environment: J, G, K, B, M, C, F, D, N, L, H.
I can move only the top block of any stack and only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so they form the target chain A on B on C ... O on table by moving consonant-labeled top blocks when appropriate.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the planner.
I must keep the actions of the two agents distinct in the multi-agent PDDL.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' observations and plan fragments to produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the target block configuration.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labelled blocks: A, J, G, K, B, M, I, C, F, D, N, L, O, H, E.
Only the top block of a stack can be moved, and agents can move only one block at a time.
One agent can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks; the other can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial stack configuration:
A is on the table.
J is on top of A.
G is on the table.
K is on top of J.
B is on the table.
M is on top of K.
I is on top of B.
C is on top of G.
F is on top of M.
D is on top of C.
N is on top of F.
L is on top of I.
O is on top of L.
H is on top of O.
E is on top of H.
Goal configuration (target):
A is on top of B.
B is on top of C.
C is on top of D.
D is on top of E.
E is on top of F.
F is on top of G.
G is on top of H.
H is on top of I.
I is on top of J.
J is on top of K.
K is on top of L.
L is on top of M.
M is on top of N.
N is on top of O.
O is on the table.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation and distributed planning. You can only move vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I, O). You may only move top blocks of stacks and only one block at a time. Provide a concise, structured natural-language fragment describing (1) which vowel blocks are currently movable (i.e., are top-of-stack), (2) suggested moves involving only vowel blocks that help reach the global goal, and (3) any assumptions or missing information you need. Do not emit PDDL; emit a clear plan fragment and observations.

You are an expert in block manipulation and distributed planning. You can only move consonant-labeled blocks (J, G, K, B, M, C, F, D, N, L, H). You may only move top blocks of stacks and only one block at a time. Provide a concise, structured natural-language fragment describing (1) which consonant blocks are currently movable (i.e., are top-of-stack), (2) suggested moves involving only consonant blocks that help reach the global goal, and (3) any assumptions or missing information you need. Do not emit PDDL; emit a clear plan fragment and observations.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for the FastDownwards planner. You will receive natural-language fragments from two agents describing observations and suggested moves. Integrate these fragments, resolve naming and compatibility issues, keep the agents' actions distinct in the multi-agent model, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Make explicit any assumptions you make to fill missing information.
